result.execSummary:
The defendant Sergio Nova was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay $3000 fine plus court costs. Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
COC COLLECT 
---------------------------------
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.

BOND QUASHED

Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sergio Nova in court.  Attorney Christopher Lyle Kuehn in court for Sergio Nova. Defendant pleads guilty to count 1. Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights filed. Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and adjudges defendant guilty. Court gives warning to deportation. Minutes filed.
